Working From Home Is Not the Same During a Pandemic

I cannot stress this enough: you need to have a password management app. There is simply no getting around it. Not today at least, with the amount of data breaches and identity theft in the air.

Jonayah M. Jackson
April 8, 2020 · 3 min read
Photo Credit: Pexels

Here’s some food for thought: How many streaming services, delivery apps, newsletters, and social media accounts does the average person have? A lot! Now imagine that you’re running a business or setting out as a freelancer, you’ll rack up many more passwords to keep track of and to protect from people who would do you harm.

Not only is it a good idea for you to have a central location to keep track of the hundreds of passwords you use for your daily life, but it’s also best practice to keep those accounts safe with secure passwords. I find that this is good advice for anyone and everyone, but it is imperative for people running a business. Long gone will be the days of losing or forgetting your passwords, getting hacked, or having your identity stolen — well, it’s a good start at the very least, but being ahead of the curve is what’s important.

Password safety + not having to remember dozens of random words

5 tips from CNET to remember about password safety:

  1. Use a password manager to keep track of your passwords.
  2. Avoid common phrases in your passwords.
  3. The longer and more complex the password, the better secure it is (start with 8 characters).
  4. Don’t recycle your passwords (I’m trying to get better at this one).
  5. Use a two-factor authentication app if possible (an app that double checks if you are the user trying to sign in).

Photo Credit: Pexels

Welceom to the Password Protected Club!

Now that you are successfully initiated into the password protected club, here are two common apps that are particularly popular with my clients: 1Password and LastPass (I’m not sponsored by either).

So, remember the password to your websites and don’t share it with anyone you don’t trust. Thanks!
